availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John R. Aubrey (Hardin County, KY, farmer, magistrate, & capt Hardin Co State Guard (U.S.A.))

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, farmer, magistrate, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy J. Pruitt Aubrey. Father of William M. Aubrey, Craven Aubrey, Nancy G. Aubrey, John Q. Aubrey, George Aubrey, Sanford Aubrey, Phillip I. Aubrey, and Berthenia Aubrey. Farmer in Hardin County in 1850. Farmer in Hardin County in 1860. Magistrate in Hardin County in 1863. Served in the Hardin County State Guard as captain from July 11, 1864, to March 11, 1865.
